title: SQL ServerASIN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerASIN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the arc sine of a number:
SELECT ASIN(0.25);

Definition and Usage
The ASIN() function returns the arc sine of a number.
The specified number must be between -1 to 1, otherwise 
this function returns NULL.
Syntax
ASIN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the arc sine of a number:
SELECT ASIN(-0.8);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerASIN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerASIN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerASIN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
